str2: Indeed now, therefore, accordingly, well then. From toi and nun; truly now, i.e. Accordingly.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Middle or Passive - 1st Person Plural
str2: To go out, come out. From ek and erchomai; to issue.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Without, outside. Adverb from ek; out(-side, of doors), literally or figuratively.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a compound of para and emballo; a throwing in beside, i.e., battle-array, encampment or barracks.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To carry, bear, bring; I conduct, lead; perhaps: I make publicly known. A primary verb.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
